subject: dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 22:18:11.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-docker-utils/functions.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/6a3cd140cd9dc35945194f3119aeb9cc883d3206', 'message': 'dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch updates authorized_keys inside squashfsed bootstrap images,
so it will be retained during backup-reinstall-restore procedure, if
user has not requested a full backup. Full backups already contain a
full copy of /var/www/nailgun, so no changes are needed.

User should carefully restore from non-full backups - only active
bootstrap will have its ssh keys updated. To propagate ssh keys to
already running nodes, you can use something like:
  mco rpc --agent execute_shell_command --action execute --arg cmd="echo '$(cat /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub)' >> /root/.ssh/authorized_keys" -v

Closes-Bug: #1536198
DocImpact
Change-Id: I9d3e5c910fb724d26fdc5fc40bd40ef2499fedc5
'}]
commit_message:
dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch updates authorized_keys inside squashfsed bootstrap images,
so it will be retained during backup-reinstall-restore procedure, if
user has not requested a full backup. Full backups already contain a
full copy of /var/www/nailgun, so no changes are needed.

User should carefully restore from non-full backups - only active
bootstrap will have its ssh keys updated. To propagate ssh keys to
already running nodes, you can use something like:
  mco rpc --agent execute_shell_command --action execute --arg cmd="echo '$(cat /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub)' >> /root/.ssh/authorized_keys" -v

Closes-Bug: #1536198
DocImpact
Change-Id: I9d3e5c910fb724d26fdc5fc40bd40ef2499fedc5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/48/275948/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nailgun) if [ "${SYSTEMD:-false}" = "true" ]; then local fullbackup fullbackup=0 if [ "$1" = "--full" ]; then elif [ "$2" = "--full" ]; then# Defer expression evaluation until the current subshell exits. # They will be called in reverse order. # Think of it as of appending an expression to the top of a finally{…} # block after a try{…}, so it will be evaluated no matter whether an # error occurs or not. It looks cleaner than multiple nested scopes # with EXIT traps. function defer { declare -ga traps traps[${#traps[*]}]=`trap` local trapcmd # We need to escape all shell metacharacters, trapcmd="$(printf "%q " "$@"); __finally" # and then unescape them inside the trap. # This trick ensures that variable expansion will be # delayed until the "defer" phase. trap "eval eval \"$(printf '"%q" ' "$trapcmd")\"" EXIT } # Helper function for "defer". # It unwinds "traps" stack. function __finally { declare -ga traps local cmd cmd="${traps[${#traps[@]}-1]}" unset traps[${#traps[@]}-1] # Parse `trap` output. eval set -- "${cmd}" if [ "$1/$2/$4" = "trap/--/EXIT" ]; then # It's an EXIT trap - evaluate the code. eval "$3" || true else # Other trap - just restore it. eval "${cmd}" fi } function update_ssh_keys { # Copy masternode's public keys inside the active bootstrap image local sqfs relative_path SQ_MOUNT_POINT COMP ssh-agent sh -c 'ssh-add ; ssh-add -L' > /tmp/authorized_keys sqfs=$(realpath /var/www/nailgun/bootstraps/active_bootstrap/root.squashfs) test -e "$sqfs" || return 0 relative_path=$(realpath --relative-to=/var/www/nailgun/bootstraps $sqfs) ( set -e SQ_MOUNT_POINT=$(mktemp -d) defer rmdir $SQ_MOUNT_POINT mount -o loop,ro $sqfs $SQ_MOUNT_POINT defer umount $SQ_MOUNT_POINT mount -t tmpfs tmpfs $SQ_MOUNT_POINT/mnt defer umount $SQ_MOUNT_POINT/mnt mkdir $SQ_MOUNT_POINT/mnt/{bootstraps,src} defer rmdir $SQ_MOUNT_POINT/mnt/{bootstraps,src} # Let chroot environment reach out to bootstrap images outside. mount --bind /var/www/nailgun/bootstraps $SQ_MOUNT_POINT/mnt/bootstraps defer umount $SQ_MOUNT_POINT/mnt/bootstraps mount --bind $SQ_MOUNT_POINT $SQ_MOUNT_POINT/mnt/src defer umount $SQ_MOUNT_POINT/mnt/src # We call unsquashfs inside the bootstrap image because there are no # squashfs-tools installed on a node itself. COMP=$(chroot $SQ_MOUNT_POINT unsquashfs -s /mnt/bootstraps/$relative_path | awk '/Compression/ { print $2 }') mount --bind /tmp/authorized_keys $SQ_MOUNT_POINT/root/.ssh/authorized_keys defer umount $SQ_MOUNT_POINT/root/.ssh/authorized_keys chroot $SQ_MOUNT_POINT mksquashfs /mnt/src/ /mnt/bootstraps/$relative_path~ -comp $COMP -no-progress -noappend mv $sqfs~ $sqfs ) } local fullrestore if [ "$2" = "--full" ]; then else fullrestore=0 if [ "$fullrestore" = "1" ]; then [ "$fullrestore" = "1" ] && restore_images "$restoredir" [ "$fullrestore" = "1" ] && rename_images "$timestamp" # We don't need to update ssh keys for a full backup/restore, # because it contains both keys and matching bootstrap images. [ "$fullrestore" = "0" ] && update_ssh_keys
deleted_lines: nailgun) if [ "${SYSTEMD:-false}" == "true" ]; then if [ "$1" == "--full" ]; then elif [ "$2" == "--full" ]; then if [ "$2" == "--full" ]; then if [ "$fullrestore" == "1" ]; then [ "$fullrestore" == "1" ] && restore_images "$restoredir" [ "$fullrestore" == "1" ] && rename_images "$timestamp"

commit_message:
Removed mutable default argument

Changed the mutable default argument in __init__
in FakeDeployment class.  Utilized a sentinel value
instead to avoid problems with the same list being
reused.

Change-Id: I2e06f1159e552e8a544ae15f5f80fa660a7fc8c4
Closes-bug: #1538517

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary filter from Resource's __repr__() function

'request_ids' is a function of class RequestIdMixin.
Resource().__dict__.keys() doesn't contains a function. So it not
necessary to filter it.

Change-Id: I73af5d1be39769f70cbe4c1ec83144d56f94f91a

commit_message:
Prevent _heal_instance_info_cache() periodic lazy-loads

This fixes _heal_instance_info_cache() so that it speculatively loads
the flavor information for an instance during initial query, instead of
always depending on lazy-load to get it (which triggers an extra RPC
and DB call for every instance).

Change-Id: Ia1d78fb48d3f131487bd7a98d3a50774c85a1fa2
Partial-Bug: #1540526

commit_message:
EMC VMAX - Fix for last volume in VMAX3 storage group

This patch fixes bug in the deletion the last volume in a
storage group for the VMAX3. If a masking view did not exist
we tried to get an instance of it which threw an exception.
Now we handle both scenarios correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1512796

Change-Id: Ideb2aaffe4fbc1ae2137d569d7b137ac0edef573
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/31/244331/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_last_vol_in_SG(self): conn = self.fake_ecom_connection() controllerConfigService = ( self.driver.common.utils.find_controller_configuration_service( conn, self.data.storage_system)) extraSpecs = {'volume_backend_name': 'V3_BE'} storageGroupName = self.data.storagegroupname storageGroupInstanceName = ( self.driver.common.utils.find_storage_masking_group( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupName)) vol = EMC_StorageVolume() vol['name'] = self.data.test_volume['name'] vol['CreationClassName'] = 'Symm_StorageVolume' vol['ElementName'] = self.data.test_volume['id'] vol['DeviceID'] = self.data.test_volume['device_id'] vol['Id'] = self.data.test_volume['id'] vol['SystemName'] = self.data.storage_system vol['NumberOfBlocks'] = self.data.test_volume['NumberOfBlocks'] vol['BlockSize'] = self.data.test_volume['BlockSize'] # Added vol to vol.path vol['SystemCreationClassName'] = 'Symm_StorageSystem' vol.path = vol vol.path.classname = vol['CreationClassName'] # Test 1. With a masking view - detach self.driver.common.masking._delete_mv_and_sg = mock.Mock() self.assertTrue(self.driver.common.masking._last_vol_in_SG( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, storageGroupName, vol, vol['name'], extraSpecs)) # Test 2. No masking view, regular delete self.driver.common.masking._delete_mv_and_sg.reset_mock() self.driver.common.masking.get_masking_view_from_storage_group = ( mock.Mock(return_value=None)) self.driver.common.masking.utils.get_existing_instance = ( mock.Mock(return_value=None)) storagegroup = {} storagegroup['CreationClassName'] = ( self.data.storagegroup_creationclass) storagegroup['ElementName'] = 'no_masking_view' self.assertTrue(self.driver.common.masking._last_vol_in_SG( conn, controllerConfigService, storagegroup, storagegroup['ElementName'], vol, vol['name'], extraSpecs)) # Test 3. No masking view, regular delete fails. self.driver.common.masking.utils.get_existing_instance.reset_mock() self.driver.common.masking.utils.get_existing_instance = ( mock.Mock(return_value='value')) self.assertRaises(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException, self.driver.common.masking._last_vol_in_SG, conn, controllerConfigService, storagegroup, storagegroup['ElementName'], vol, vol['name'], extraSpecs)

subject: Expose method list inconsistency in federation api
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-29 19:57:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/2451369867ac0e014e311e01d2a5b93352393e1b', 'message': "Expose method list inconsistency in federation api

The federated authentication API currently returns ['saml2'] as the
authentication method, regardless if you used an unscoped token to get a
project scoped one. In that case, the project scoped response should also
return ['saml2', 'token'].

Change-Id: I327e4c0c5b58e1c1ab2ea7417773ed5c7546baf3

methods when rescoping tokens. This patch exposes those bugs in the current

commit_message:
Expose method list inconsistency in federation api

The federated authentication API might return the wrong list of authentication
methods when rescoping tokens. This patch exposes those bugs in the current
tests and documents them.

Related-Bug: 1501032

Change-Id: I327e4c0c5b58e1c1ab2ea7417773ed5c7546baf3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/25/229125/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Handle cases where exc_args can't be serialized as JSON in the WBE

First try to get them, but if they aren't able to be serialized,
just return the failure without them.  This only affects the WBE
that serializes failures as part of the JSON response that is sent
over the wire from the worker process to the WBE engine.

Change-Id: I86e3255b612bc15097aabe63a684cf8b8808e61b

added_lines: import json serializable_exc_args = [] for arg in list(self.exception_args): try: json.dumps(arg) except TypeError: serializable_exc_args.append(str(arg)) else: serializable_exc_args.append(arg) 'exc_args': tuple(serializable_exc_args),

commit_message:
sanitize IPv6 in keystone provider

In keystone.rb provider, we need to make sure the ipv6 returned in
clean_host method has brackets.
If brackets are missing, the provider will fail to manage Keystone
resources, because of parsing issue and the multiple ":" in the host
value.

Change-Id: Ibdb340642270afae64b1055ef5fb97281b17066d
Closes-Bug: #1541512
(cherry picked from commit f710bed6aa445c33d3d307bdc144b6f7534d1282)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/36/275836/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it 'should use [2620:52:0:23a9::25] in the admin endpoint if bind_host is 2620:52:0:23a9::25' do mock = {'DEFAULT' => { 'admin_bind_host' => '2620:52:0:23a9::25', 'admin_port' => '5001' }} File.expects(:exists?).with("/etc/keystone/keystone.conf").returns(true) Puppet::Util::IniConfig::File.expects(:new).returns(mock) mock.expects(:read).with('/etc/keystone/keystone.conf') expect(klass.get_admin_endpoint).to eq('http://[2620:52:0:23a9::25]:5001') end

commit_message:
sanitize IPv6 in keystone provider

In keystone.rb provider, we need to make sure the ipv6 returned in
clean_host method has brackets.
If brackets are missing, the provider will fail to manage Keystone
resources, because of parsing issue and the multiple ":" in the host
value.

Change-Id: Ibdb340642270afae64b1055ef5fb97281b17066d
Closes-Bug: #1541512

commit_message:
Updated CORS documentation for oslo_middleware v3.0.0

This patch adjusts language in the CORS documentation to be
less proscriptive about the preferred configuration method
(paste vs. oslo). Furthermore, it updates the code samples to
demonstrate new configuration features available in 3.0.0.

Change-Id: Iabb902ffb01d9713f437b7efc777ce6b6a565486
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/66/236966/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In some cases, CORS support is built directly into the service itself. To allowed_origin = https://first_ui.example.com, https://second_ui.example.comYou may also add additional origins explicitly. To express this inIn other cases, CORS is configured via PasteDeploy. In this case,.. note:: To add an additional domain in oslo_middleware v2.4.0, simply add another filter. In v2.10.0 and after, you may add multiple domains in the above allowed_origin field, separated by commas.
deleted_lines: In most cases, CORS support is built directly into the service itself. To allowed_origin = https://first_ui.example.comThis method also enables you to define multiple origins. To express this inIn other services, CORS is configured via PasteDeploy. In this case,.. note:: To add another domain, simply add another filter.

commit_message:
Fix CSAR usage in README

The CSAR support is provided now and needs to be corrected in README.

Change-Id: I40601bf58274a89c7d50eab2e20aeee3acea1018
Closes-Bug: 1541518
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tosca-parser refs/changes/56/275856/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The TOSCA Parser takes TOSCA YAML template or TOSCA Cloud Service Archive (CSAR) file as an input, with optional input of dictionary of needed parameters with their values, and produces in-memory objects of different TOSCA elements with their relationship to each other. It also creates a graph of TOSCA node templates and their relationship.this class. In order to see an example usage of TOSCA Parser from a separate tool, refer to the OpenStack heat-translator class TranslateTemplate located in the translator/osc/v1/translate.py module. The toscaparser/shell.py module of tosca-parser also provides a good reference on how to invoke TOSCA Parser from Command Line Interface.
deleted_lines: The TOSCA Parser takes TOSCA YAML template as an input, with optional input of dictionary of needed parameters with their values, and produces in-memory objects of different TOSCA elements with their relationship to each other. It also creates a graph of TOSCA node templates and their relationship. The support for parsing template within TOSCA CSAR is under development.this class. In order to see an example usage, refer to the heat-translator class TranslateTemplate located in the translator/osc/v1/translate.py module.

commit_message:
Exclude xvfbwrapper 0.2.8 from global requirements

Recent update of xvfbwrapper broke Horizon integration tests and while
we're investigating the root cause it's better to unblock the gate.

Change-Id: I3b3df0ec8f49dc1bf54801c1c35cd5fc5b32654d
Related-Bug: #1540495
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/55/275155/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: xvfbwrapper>=0.1.3,!=0.2.8 #license: MIT

commit_message:
xenapi: simplify swap_xapi_host()

This patch directly use temp_url.hostname instead of temp_url.netloc
to simplify swap_xapi_host().

Change-Id: I73be8e5777efe400a99ba3bb3a0a264f78755dc8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/266258/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return url.replace(temp_url.hostname, '%s' % host_addr)
deleted_lines: _netloc, sep, port = temp_url.netloc.partition(':') return url.replace(temp_url.netloc, '%s%s%s' % (host_addr, sep, port))

'}, {'number': 20, 'created': '2016-01-26 15:53:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/13af059335cfd6fa82f08f7386dfe78d10d28af3', 'message': 'Create jobs for a wheel mirror

In order to speed up tests where we install python packages we want to
create wheels for packages we depend on.

This patch creates three new scripts:

* wheel-build, which generates all wheels, from all branches, in `pwd`/wheels
* wheel-copy, which copies this wheels directory into our AFS file structure.
* wheel-index, which rebuilds the index.html file from the directories
  found in the afs directory.

The above scripts are executed in sequence, with afs credentials only loaded
where necessary. Additional timeouts have been provided to prevent things from
locking.

This patch assumes that a mod_rewrite rule will be available on the serving nodes
that unmunges the URL.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>
Depends-On: Ie33861dbcb413c34012820fda76f8be94fb1d151

Change-Id: I3463fba889239c565c86ffb080adffd7bfdd18f9
'}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2016-01-26 15:56:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/a6c1eddc234f6c0acedfeb4bd00037e027fe0461', 'message': 'Create jobs for a wheel mirror

The above scripts are executed in sequence, with afs credentials only loaded

This patch assumes that a mod_rewrite rule will be available on the serving nodes

commit_message:
Create jobs for a wheel mirror

In order to speed up tests where we install python packages we want to
create wheels for packages we depend on.

This patch creates four new scripts:

* afs-slug, which generates a string version of the platform architecture,
  derived from the host system's parameters.
* wheel-build, which generates all wheels, from all branches, in `pwd`/wheels
* wheel-copy, which copies this wheels directory into our AFS file structure.
* wheel-index, which rebuilds the index.html file from the directories
  found in the afs directory.

The above scripts are executed in sequence, with afs credentials only loaded
where necessary. Additional timeouts have been provided to prevent things from
locking.

This patch assumes that a mod_rewrite rule will be available on the serving nodes
that unmunges the URL.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>
Depends-On: Ie33861dbcb413c34012820fda76f8be94fb1d151
Depends-On: I81c39d420d8ac70def57949ea0d4c323b8797086
Change-Id: I3463fba889239c565c86ffb080adffd7bfdd18f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/27/164927/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - wheel-mirror-ubuntu-trusty-amd64 - wheel-mirror-ubuntu-precise-amd64 - wheel-mirror-centos-7-amd64 periodic: - wheel-mirror-ubuntu-trusty-amd64 - wheel-mirror-ubuntu-precise-amd64 - wheel-mirror-centos-7-amd64

subject: Refactor security group delete to use SDK
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-14 19:36:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/5b68fd622a8a4fe87163d85509e0be75aa28ba07', 'message': "Refactor security group delete to use SDK

Refactored the 'os security group delete' command to use the SDK
when neutron is enabled, but continue to use the nova client when
nova network is enabled.

This patch set introduces a new NetworkAndComputeCommand class
to be used for commands that must support neutron and nova network.
The current DeleteSecurityGroup class is now a subclass of this
new class and has moved under the network v2 commands.

This patch set also introduces a new FakeSecurityGroup class for
testing security groups.

Change-Id: Ic21376b86b40cc6d97f360f3760ba5beed154537
Depends-On: Ia37e81d4fb05a1e2fceb3e5d367bda769ab8e64b
Partial-Bug: #1519511

Refactored the 'os security group delete' command to use the SDK
when neutron is enabled, but continue to use the nova client when
nova network is enabled.

This patch set introduces a new NetworkAndComputeCommand class
to be used for commands that must support neutron and nova network.
The new class allows both the parser and actions to be unique.
The current DeleteSecurityGroup class is now a subclass of this
new class and has moved under the network v2 commands.

This patch set also introduces a new FakeSecurityGroup class for
testing security groups.

Change-Id: Ic21376b86b40cc6d97f360f3760ba5beed154537
Depends-On: Ia37e81d4fb05a1e2fceb3e5d367bda769ab8e64b

Related-to: blueprint neutron-client
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-12-29 16:17:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/48e0670a3221c142c106b0394d6624ab7a898f57', 'message': "Refactor security group delete to use SDK

Refactored the 'os security group delete' command to use the SDK
when neutron is enabled, but continue to use the nova client when
nova network is enabled.

This patch set introduces a new NetworkAndComputeCommand class
to be used for commands that must support neutron and nova network.
The new class allows both the parser and actions to be unique.
The current DeleteSecurityGroup class is now a subclass of this
new class and has moved under the network v2 commands.

This patch set also introduces a new FakeSecurityGroup class for
testing security groups.

And finally, this patch set updates the command documentation
for security group and security group rule to indicate that
Network v2 is also used.

Change-Id: Ic21376b86b40cc6d97f360f3760ba5beed154537
Depends-On: Ia37e81d4fb05a1e2fceb3e5d367bda769ab8e64b

commit_message:
Refactor security group delete to use SDK

Refactored the 'os security group delete' command to use the SDK
when neutron is enabled, but continue to use the nova client when
nova network is enabled.

This patch set introduces a new NetworkAndComputeCommand class
to be used for commands that must support neutron and nova network.
The new class allows both the parser and actions to be unique.
The current DeleteSecurityGroup class is now a subclass of this
new class and has moved under the network v2 commands.

This patch set also introduces a new FakeSecurityGroup class for
testing security groups.

And finally, this patch set updates the command documentation
for security group and security group rule to indicate that
Network v2 is also used.

Change-Id: Ic21376b86b40cc6d97f360f3760ba5beed154537
Partial-Bug: #1519511
Related-to: blueprint neutron-client
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/43/257543/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: class DeleteSecurityGroup(command.Command): """Delete a security group""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + '.DeleteSecurityGroup') def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(DeleteSecurityGroup, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'group', metavar='<group>', help='Security group to delete (name or ID)', ) return parser @utils.log_method(log) def take_action(self, parsed_args): compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute data = utils.find_resource( compute_client.security_groups, parsed_args.group, ) compute_client.security_groups.delete(data.id) return

commit_message:
Make libvirt live migration transportation type configurable

Libvirt support a range of transports, currently the live migration only
uses ssh, and it will be better that the transport type configurable.

Because different transport type has different URI format, we keep the live
migration URI as configuration.

Change-Id: Ib8740a8fcd3292c63e27254b0b53ea86a1d8775a

commit_message:
Add exc_filter for invalid Unicode string

This error occurs if passing a Unicode string to the
database which cannot be stored (i.e. it contains chars
>4 bytes long and the db is not configured to handle
that).

Change-Id: I12311909dec6e447c93917a5efd68599f35c4b89
Related-Bug: #1393871

commit_message:
Add autodetection for 32/64 bit Cirros image

use 'uname' to get the host's arch, and then choose the right Cirros image's
arch.

Change-Id: Ica4a753d817079d9ff23b03cdc1a28aebb52031a
Closes-bug: 1252038

commit_message:
Add an extra tempest worker by default

Tempest with 4 worker might not be well balanced,
it is possible one worker runs for 18 minutes,
the other for 46 minutes.

By using an extra worker, each worker needs to
run less test, it is expected to help us to finish earlier,
even if the cpu load will be little bit higher
in the first 15 minute.

Change-Id: I89d3e69da2daa2eba1a3b189e157fc3f8ab170db

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

commit_message:
Stop n-net with n-cpu for partial upgrades

In a real environment, n-net will be co-located with n-cpu, and
upgraded at the same time. For the sake of expediency, this patch
makes n-cpu and n-net be started and stopped at the same time as
"the compute family of services." Grenade's existing partial upgrade
support will still apply, and we'll get a more realistic test.

Since grenade uses devstack old to do the shutdown, we need to backport
moving n-net to stop_nova_compute to make Kilo -> master (Liberty) job work.
But we don't want to move n-net to start_nova_compute in order to make
sure Juno->Kilo still works (and does restart nova-compute during
partial upgrade).

Generating a new change ID, so we can use depends on.

(cherry picked from commit 18e9151b03583ba2426e95fc74d1733633777eb0)
Co-Authored-By: Joe Gordon <joe.gordon0@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibf22143cb0a1bd56d8457eff6d2807307d264ae0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/84/190084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(danms): We're conflating all the things that run on a compute # host into the "nova_compute service" here. That means n-cpu and n-net. run_process n-net "$NOVA_BIN_DIR/nova-network --config-file $compute_cell_conf" # NOTE(danms): We're conflating all the things that run on a compute # host into the "nova_compute service" here. That means n-cpu and n-net. stop_process n-net for serv in n-api n-crt n-sch n-novnc n-xvnc n-cauth n-spice n-cond n-cell n-cell n-api-meta n-obj n-sproxy; do
deleted_lines: run_process n-net "$NOVA_BIN_DIR/nova-network --config-file $compute_cell_conf" for serv in n-api n-crt n-net n-sch n-novnc n-xvnc n-cauth n-spice n-cond n-cell n-cell n-api-meta n-obj n-sproxy; do

Change nginx directory for dumps

We will redirect shotgun to generate snapshot in
/var/log/dump to make use of more space available in /var/
log

commit_message:
Change dump target in settings to /var/dump.

This will make use of new dump placing introduced by library change this
patch depends on. Dump will be on the same block device as /var/log,
which will make use of additional disk space available in /var/log.

Change-Id: Iec127e0d11194c7a89a2fb80203f173dc4ca3c98
Closes-bug: 1529182
Depends-on: I0c0832d0c10350898b16d68ed195677fcf975377

Use 'addCleanup' instead of 'tearDown' in engine(s) test

Change-Id: I1d9b13b6f5cd48b7ac98f5c34ef9cb837f9ca7d1

commit_message:
Validate that all the containers are started

Container maybe exit after deployed. But the print_failure
never runs if the kolla-ansible run success.
This PS checks all the containers status after deploy and
failed the test if the container status is exited

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Ia461b280855eda500e143ee1d6cfd5f215eaf6fe
(cherry picked from commit 7ec170a9ff6efe58afecf4474efa006cf823e181)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/68/275468/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function check_failure { failed_containers=$(docker ps -a --format "{{.Names}}" --filter status=exited) for failed in ${failed_containers}; do docker logs --tail all ${failed} if [[ -n ${failed_containers} ]]; then echo 'FAILED' exit 1 fitools/kolla-ansible deploy check_failure
deleted_lines: function print_failure { for failed in $(docker ps -a --format "{{.Names}}" --filter status=exited); do docker logs --tail=all $failed echo "FAILED" exit 1tools/kolla-ansible deploy || print_failure # TODO(SamYaple): Actually validate that all containers are started docker ps -a

subject: Be explicit when installing clients from src
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-14 01:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/swift.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/manila.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/nova.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/keystone.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/glance.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/heat.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/cinder.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/sahara.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/trove.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/ceilometer.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/osc.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/neutron.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/zaqar.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/515d2adaf904386bf77adeed6f48c19b8caef8b1', 'message': "Be explicit when installing clients from src

Most jobs installing client libs from pypi now, this means that we don't
need set up the client lib git repos by default in devstack-gate. But
before we can clean up devstack-gate the jobs that do need the clients
need to explicitly state that.

Note that this also setups up ironic and related things because of how
the ironic jobs work they all share a common macro.

Change-Id: I97cc3758d5c97494704406d779a7326420940427
"}]
commit_message:
Be explicit when installing clients from src

Most jobs installing client libs from pypi now, this means that we don't
need set up the client lib git repos by default in devstack-gate. But
before we can clean up devstack-gate the jobs that do need the clients
need to explicitly state that.

Note that this also setups up ironic and related things because of how
the ironic jobs work they all share a common macro.

Change-Id: I97cc3758d5c97494704406d779a7326420940427

commit_message:
Restart horizon when package/venvs change

Currently, upgrading a horizon package/venv does not explicitly trigger
a restart.  A restart will only occur if an explicit or implicit config
change occurs.

This commit adds several restart notifiers such that a horizon package
upgrade or venv replacement will force a restart.

Note that this issue exists in all OpenStack roles at the moment, but
the remaining roles are being addressed in their re-deploy venv
reviews.  The horizon re-deploy venv change was merged a while back
which is why we need the separate review for this.

Change-Id: I890e46bb7a2973c3582be7a37ee70730d1e3ffef
(cherry picked from commit 023f73d3a906ead60ccd1d5e8be961bfe635ab16)

commit_message:
Network: Abstract get_body() out to be a private helper.

get_body() is needed in each network files to construct a dict
to pass to sdk proxy. And it is also used by several functions
in each file. So define it as a file level private helper function.

The unified prototype should be:

    def _get_attrs(client_manager, parsed_args):

1. The name, in sdk, the parameter passed to proxy is named "attrs".
   And it is a private method. So let's call it _get_attrs().
2. The parameters, besides parsed_args, when we deal with project
   and project_domain, we have to make use of identity_client. So
   let's pass in the client manager.

Change-Id: Ib044ebd4ddedbcd805f46334a7fe99e4ebb5b249

commit_message:
Add availability zone support for router commands

This patch allows the adding of availability_zone_hints during
router create. Also allows for the display of availability_zones
during list and and show commands.

Change-Id: Ifbc5c218bc7103d28076d726212ce25321bcf7f1
Partial-bug: #1519503
Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-client

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 13:48:31.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/ceilometer/compute.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/dee9d1e095f92c75f633c370359c0214d8766a98', 'message': "avoid to premature restart nova-compute by ceilometer

There is ceilometer-compute compute task that configures ceilometer
and restarts nova-compute in order to apply new settings. It is totally
correct behaviour for compute node. But for compute-vmware it restarts
unconfigured nova-compute. As a result nova-compute starts
with the wrong parameter host (nodename instead vcenter-servicename)
and registers in the nova database with that paramter. Then

nova-compute that also registers in the database.

Therefore we got the record in the database for nova-compute and host a
equal nodename. When ostf test checks that all process are alive it
found this record and decides that it's dead. And test failed.

will configured and solves this problem.

commit_message:
avoid to premature restart nova-compute by ceilometer

There is ceilometer-compute compute task that configures ceilometer
and restarts nova-compute in order to apply new settings. It is totally
correct behaviour for compute node. But for compute-vmware it restarts
unconfigured nova-compute. As a result nova-compute starts
with the wrong parameter host (nodename instead vcenter-servicename)
and registers in the nova database with that paramter. Then
top-role-compute-vmware sets right value for host and restarts
nova-compute that also registers in the database.

Therefore we got the record in the database for nova-compute and host a
equal nodename. When ostf test checks that all process are alive it
found this record and decides that it's dead. And test failed.

This commit allows to avoid premature restarts nova-compute before it
will configured and solves this problem.

Change-Id: Ica3136423303c4ed9f36a194080d3489a793f980
Closes-bug: #1529840
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/05/275705/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # On a compute node we need to restart nova-compute service in orderto apply # new settings. On a compute-vmware the top-role-compute-vmware task do it. if (roles_include('compute')) { include ::nova::params service { 'nova-compute': ensure => 'running', name => $::nova::params::compute_service_name, }
deleted_lines: # We need to restart nova-compute service in orderto apply new settings include ::nova::params service { 'nova-compute': ensure => 'running', name => $::nova::params::compute_service_name,

commit_message:
Cleanup translation scripts

Remove now unused functions and rename new functions:
* Removed setup_project, renamed setup_django to setup_project
* Removed extract_messages, renamed extract_messages_new to
  extract_messages
* Removed extract_messages_log, renamed extract_messages_log_new to
  extract_messages_log.

Remove quotation marks around 0/1 for integer comparisons.

Change-Id: Iacdd8bd3a1f715bda14b402af7ba36044c345465
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/25/275225/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Setup a project for Zanata. This is used by both Python and Django # projects. local modulename=$2 local version=${3:-master} /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/create-zanata-xml.py \ -p $project -v $version --srcdir $modulename/locale \ --txdir $modulename/locale -r '**/*.pot' \ '{locale_with_underscore}/LC_MESSAGES/{filename}.po' -f zanata.xml }
deleted_lines: # Setup a project for Zanata local version=${2:-master} /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/create-zanata-xml.py -p $project \ -v $version --srcdir ${project}/locale --txdir ${project}/locale \ -f zanata.xml } local project=$1 # In case this is an initial run, the locale directory might not # exist, so create it since extract_messages will fail if it does # not exist. So, create it if needed. mkdir -p ${project}/locale # Update the .pot files # The "_C" and "_P" prefix are for more-gettext-support blueprint, # "_C" for message with context, "_P" for plural form message. python setup.py $QUIET extract_messages --keyword "_C:1c,2 _P:1,2" } # TODO(amotoki): Finally this should replace current extract_messages. function extract_messages_new { # NOTE(amotoki): POT file == $modulename/locale/$modulename.pot local project=$1 local POT local trans # Update the .pot files for level in $LEVELS ; do POT=${project}/locale/${project}-log-${level}.pot python setup.py $QUIET extract_messages --no-default-keywords \ --keyword ${LKEYWORD[$level]} \ --output-file ${POT} # We don't need to add or send around empty source files. trans=$(msgfmt --statistics -o /dev/null ${POT} 2>&1) if [ "$trans" = "0 translated messages." ] ; then rm $POT # Remove file from git if it's under version control. git rm --ignore-unmatch $POT fi done } # TODO(amotoki): Finally this should replace current extract_messages_log. function extract_messages_log_new { # NOTE(amotoki): POT file == $modulename/locale/$modulename.pot# TODO(amotoki): After we use $modulename/locale/$modulename.pot # for normal python projects, this function will be used both # by python and django projects. It should be renamed to setup_project. # Setup django project for Zanata function setup_django { local project=$1 local modulename=$2 local version=${3:-master} /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/create-zanata-xml.py \ -p $project -v $version --srcdir $modulename/locale \ --txdir $modulename/locale -r '**/*.pot' \ '{locale_with_underscore}/LC_MESSAGES/{filename}.po' -f zanata.xml }

commit_message:
Re-Enable django_openstack_auth/designate-dashboard translations

Also, remove liberty jobs for these so that we do not need to backport
or handle them extra.

Backporting would break packaging by third parties, therefore not an
option.

Designate-dashboard setup is broken in liberty anyhow, so no need to
handle it extra. django_openstack_auth is good translated, and we're at
the end of translation.

Besides re-enabling the translations using the new setup, we can now
remove the old function setup_django_openstack_auth since it's not used
anymore.

Story: 2000452
Change-Id: I8b72a148d0f0e89d61807eee50a772e1fbcecaa2

subject: Fix Port resource properties
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-27 22:40:15.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/network/v2/test_port.py', 'openstack/network/v2/port.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/e5d0e74469038eef76bbaaf516f4843b7d0d1061', 'message': 'Fix Port resource properties

While implementing the OpenStackClient "port show" command [1],
the following problems were identified with the Port resource
object:
  -- allowed_address_pairs is not a dict
  -- binding_profile is a dict
  -- dns_assignment was not explicitely parsed
  -- dns_name was not explicitely parsed
  -- extra_dhcp_opts is not a dict
  -- security_groups is a list

Most of these problems do not cause any issues for the "port show"
command. However, the allowed_address_pairs and extra_dhcp_opts
problems cause the "port show" command to fail due to SDK parsing
problems when these properties contain data.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/273242/

Change-Id: Ifd94cd2176ebc868b023cdc260d38f147955f772
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Port resource properties

While implementing the OpenStackClient "port show" command [1],
the following problems were identified with the Port resource
object:
  -- allowed_address_pairs is not a dict
  -- binding_profile is a dict
  -- dns_assignment was not explicitely parsed
  -- dns_name was not explicitely parsed
  -- extra_dhcp_opts is not a dict
  -- security_groups is a list

Most of these problems do not cause any issues for the "port show"
command. However, the allowed_address_pairs and extra_dhcp_opts
problems cause the "port show" command to fail due to SDK parsing
problems when these properties contain data.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/273242/

Change-Id: Ifd94cd2176ebc868b023cdc260d38f147955f772

commit_message:
Remove conditional checking the auth_strategy values

In the dhcp/neutron.py module there was a conditional checking if
the values of the CONF.neutron.auth_strategy was set to "noauth" or
"keystone". That check is not needed anymore since that configuration
option is now using the "choices" parameter from oslo.config to limit
and check what are the valid values for that configuration option.

Change-Id: I61c5e83b06a370bbc4cca48c8812f9b4b934aef8

commit_message:
Update documentation for NFV profile support

The TOSCA parser now supports parsing NFV profile and work is ongoing for
advance support. Update the doc accordingly.

Co-Authored-By: Bob Haddleton <bob.haddleton@nokia.com>
Change-Id: I42c16773881381dca9d88fb231bee819ed7033a1

commit_message:
Use regex for matching node in rabbit-fence logs

Currently it's possible to add special prefixes for
hostnames which are used by RabbitMQ (messaging network).
Modified tests, so such prefixes are ignored while
parsing rabbit-fence logs.

Also change 'get_rabbit_running_nodes' method to
omit node name prefixes while returning list of running
nodes.

Change-Id: I63bac7c4eafa61fc756d033dadd7d2ba662eaf4c
Closes-bug: #1538597

added_lines: from neutron.agent.l3 import rt_tablesSNAT_TABLE_START = 32769 SNAT_TABLE_END = 33769 self.snat_rt_tables_manager = rt_tables.RoutingTablesManager( self.ns_name, id_range=range(SNAT_TABLE_START, SNAT_TABLE_END)) snat_routing_table): table=snat_routing_table) if is_add: snat_rt = self.snat_rt_tables_manager.add(sn_int) table=snat_rt.name) table=snat_rt.name, snat_rt = self.snat_rt_tables_manager.get(sn_int) if snat_rt: self._delete_gateway_device_if_exists( ns_ipd, gw_ip_addr, snat_rt.name) ns_ipr.rule.delete(ip=sn_port_cidr, table=snat_rt.name, priority=SNAT_PRIORITY) with self.snat_rt_tables_manager: super(DvrLocalRouter, self).process(agent, delete)
deleted_lines: import binasciiimport six @staticmethod def _get_snat_idx(ip_cidr): """Generate index for DVR snat rules and route tables. The index value has to be 32 bits or less but more than the system generated entries i.e. 32768. For IPv4 use the numeric value of the cidr. For IPv6 generate a crc32 bit hash and xor-fold to 30 bits. Use the freed range to extend smaller values so that they become greater than system generated entries. """ net = netaddr.IPNetwork(ip_cidr) if net.version == 6: if isinstance(ip_cidr, six.text_type): ip_cidr = ip_cidr.encode() # Needed for Python 3.x # the crc32 & 0xffffffff is for Python 2.6 and 3.0 compatibility snat_idx = binascii.crc32(ip_cidr) & 0xffffffff # xor-fold the hash to reserve upper range to extend smaller values snat_idx = (snat_idx >> 30) ^ (snat_idx & MASK_30) if snat_idx < 32768: snat_idx = snat_idx + MASK_30 else: snat_idx = net.value return snat_idx snat_idx): table=snat_idx) snat_idx = self._get_snat_idx(sn_port_cidr) if is_add: table=snat_idx) table=snat_idx, self._delete_gateway_device_if_exists(ns_ipd, gw_ip_addr, snat_idx) ns_ipr.rule.delete(ip=sn_port_cidr, table=snat_idx, priority=SNAT_PRIORITY) super(DvrLocalRouter, self).process(agent, delete)

commit_message:
Unify ip rule priority in router namespace

It doesn't seem to be necessary to have unique priorities for every
rule as long as the rules are not ambiguous and don't need to be
prioritized.  Removing this reduces the complexity a lot.

Since IP overlap is not enable in router namespace, every rule in
router namespace should be unique, not ambiguous. And for future plan
to enable IP overlap in router namespace, we can add 'iif' parameter
to locate ip rules.

The following link is a discussion reference about keeping ip rule
in the same priority if they are not ambiguous:
http://marc.info/?l=linux-netdev&m=145255331814388&w=2

Co-Authored-By: ZongKai LI <lzklibj@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I78a5dc0bed948a89362b7b288b43df3d8ac4bba2

deleted_lines: # Copyright 2015 IBM Corporation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from neutron.agent.l3.item_allocator import ItemAllocator class FipPriority(object): def __init__(self, index): self.index = index def __repr__(self): return str(self.index) def __hash__(self): return hash(self.__repr__()) def __eq__(self, other): if isinstance(other, FipPriority): return (self.index == other.index) else: return False class FipRulePriorityAllocator(ItemAllocator): """Manages allocation of floating ips rule priorities. IP rule priorities assigned to DVR floating IPs need to be preserved over L3 agent restarts. This class provides an allocator which saves the prirorities to a datastore which will survive L3 agent restarts. """ def __init__(self, data_store_path, priority_rule_start, priority_rule_end): """Create the necessary pool and create the item allocator using ',' as the delimiter and FipRulePriorityAllocator as the class type """ pool = set(FipPriority(str(s)) for s in range(priority_rule_start, priority_rule_end)) super(FipRulePriorityAllocator, self).__init__(data_store_path, FipPriority, pool)

commit_message:
Fix spawn error hook in "continue_node_clean" RPC method

1) utils.cleaning_error_handler() as hook in current code does not
have an exception parameter that task context manager adds.
2) It's not needed to set fail state on "NoFreeConductorWorker"
exception, this is driver specific. IPA driver can obtain a free
worker on the next heartbeat(s).

This patch also adds missing tests for error handlers functions.

Closes-Bug: #1539118
Change-Id: I9081d5b3437e9be6b68fe9c635b38f84637e93df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/94/273594/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def spawn_cleaning_error_handler(e, node): """Handle spawning error for node cleaning.""" if isinstance(e, exception.NoFreeConductorWorker): node.last_error = (_("No free conductor workers available")) node.save() LOG.warning(_LW("No free conductor workers available to perform " "cleaning on node %(node)s"), {'node': node.uuid})

commit_message:
Remove deprecated options from NFS driver

In the Liberty release, the NFS driver deprecated the 'nfs_used_ratio'
and 'nfs_oversubscription_ratio' configuration options since equivalent
common functionality is now provided across drivers by the scheduler-aware
'reserved_percentage' and 'max_over_sucscription_ratio' configuration
options.

This commit removes these deprecated options, tests for same, and
some Liberty code that proviced backwards compatibility with respect to
these options.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia3af9cbe69b2342649fe378aefe6ed1e46a82b19

commit_message:
Revise the compute_upgrade_levels_auto release note

This revises that compute node release note to describe the SIGHUP
service behavior impacts.

Related to blueprint service-version-behavior

Change-Id: I5030cba5e12d3cdfbb563258358c2e43e66bcc08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/273441/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if asked, and only do this automatic behavior if 'auto' is configured. When 'auto' is used, sending a SIGHUP to the service will cause the value to be re-calculated. Thus, after an upgrade is complete, sending SIGHUP to all services will cause them to start sending messages compliant with the newer RPC version.
deleted_lines: if asked, and only do this automatic behavior if 'auto' is configured.

enginefacade: 'network'

Use enginefacade in 'network' section.

Implements: blueprint new-oslodb-enginefacade

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ia07a2254dcdd334f25975b2d9600bbb361a9ee4b

Includes:
- Migration for roles
- Driver and core changed for implied roles
- Support for implied roles in manager assignment testing
- Add controller support for API, as well as augment the results
  of list_assignment for implied roles
- Add implied roles to project and domain tokens.
- Default LDAP functions required for ABC
- Test Implied roles for groups
- Add implied_roles entries to json home test
- Skip role inference when methods are unimplemented in the driver
- Enable/disable via config (and tests)

Co-Authored-By: Henry Nash <henryn@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

implements: blueprint implied-roles

Change-Id: I812843adb9a1748fb471325797dad80e1baea565

commit_message:
Implied Roles API

CRD for implied roles.
Iplied roles are expanded in token issue and validation responses.
Explicitly forbids creating a rule with admin as the implied role to
  avoid escalation of privileges.

Co-Authored-By: Henry Nash <henryn@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
implements: blueprint implied-roles
Change-Id: I812843adb9a1748fb471325797dad80e1baea565
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/14/242614/68 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_implied_role(self, prior_role_id, implied_role_id): raise exception.NotImplemented() # pragma: no cover def delete_implied_role(self, prior_role_id, implied_role_id): raise exception.NotImplemented() # pragma: no cover def list_implied_roles(self, prior_role_id): raise exception.NotImplemented() # pragma: no cover # NOTE(henry-nash): A mixin class to enable the sharing of the LDAP structure
deleted_lines: # NOTE(heny-nash): A mixin class to enable the sharing of the LDAP structure

commit_message:
enginefacade: 'instance_metadata'

Use enginefacade in 'instance_metadata' section.

Implements: blueprint new-oslodb-enginefacade

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I3709c52743b637546a68f89106b70334f14e5b96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/262258/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _instance_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid): return model_query(context, models.InstanceMetadata, read_deleted="no").\@main_context_manager.reader@main_context_manager.writer@main_context_manager.writer if delete: _instance_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid).\ filter(~models.InstanceMetadata.key.in_(all_keys)).\ soft_delete(synchronize_session=False) already_existing_keys = [] meta_refs = _instance_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid).\ filter(models.InstanceMetadata.key.in_(all_keys)).\ all() for meta_ref in meta_refs: already_existing_keys.append(meta_ref.key) meta_ref.update({"value": metadata[meta_ref.key]}) new_keys = set(all_keys) - set(already_existing_keys) for key in new_keys: meta_ref = models.InstanceMetadata() meta_ref.update({"key": key, "value": metadata[key], "instance_uuid": instance_uuid}) context.session.add(meta_ref) return metadatadef _instance_system_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid): return model_query(context, models.InstanceSystemMetadata).\@main_context_manager.reader@main_context_manager.writer if delete: _instance_system_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid).\ filter(~models.InstanceSystemMetadata.key.in_(all_keys)).\ soft_delete(synchronize_session=False) already_existing_keys = [] meta_refs = _instance_system_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid).\ filter(models.InstanceSystemMetadata.key.in_(all_keys)).\ all() for meta_ref in meta_refs: already_existing_keys.append(meta_ref.key) meta_ref.update({"value": metadata[meta_ref.key]}) new_keys = set(all_keys) - set(already_existing_keys) for key in new_keys: meta_ref = models.InstanceSystemMetadata() meta_ref.update({"key": key, "value": metadata[key], "instance_uuid": instance_uuid}) context.session.add(meta_ref) return metadata
deleted_lines: def _instance_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid, session=None): return model_query(context, models.InstanceMetadata, session=session, read_deleted="no").\ session = get_session() with session.begin(subtransactions=True): if delete: _instance_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid, session=session).\ filter(~models.InstanceMetadata.key.in_(all_keys)).\ soft_delete(synchronize_session=False) already_existing_keys = [] meta_refs = _instance_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid, session=session).\ filter(models.InstanceMetadata.key.in_(all_keys)).\ all() for meta_ref in meta_refs: already_existing_keys.append(meta_ref.key) meta_ref.update({"value": metadata[meta_ref.key]}) new_keys = set(all_keys) - set(already_existing_keys) for key in new_keys: meta_ref = models.InstanceMetadata() meta_ref.update({"key": key, "value": metadata[key], "instance_uuid": instance_uuid}) session.add(meta_ref) return metadatadef _instance_system_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid, session=None): return model_query(context, models.InstanceSystemMetadata, session=session).\ session = get_session() with session.begin(subtransactions=True): if delete: _instance_system_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid, session=session).\ filter(~models.InstanceSystemMetadata.key.in_(all_keys)).\ soft_delete(synchronize_session=False) already_existing_keys = [] meta_refs = _instance_system_metadata_get_query(context, instance_uuid, session=session).\ filter(models.InstanceSystemMetadata.key.in_(all_keys)).\ all() for meta_ref in meta_refs: already_existing_keys.append(meta_ref.key) meta_ref.update({"value": metadata[meta_ref.key]}) new_keys = set(all_keys) - set(already_existing_keys) for key in new_keys: meta_ref = models.InstanceSystemMetadata() meta_ref.update({"key": key, "value": metadata[key], "instance_uuid": instance_uuid}) session.add(meta_ref) return metadata

commit_message:
Comment out test options that already exists on tempest's tree

Since we can't remove ironic's  tests and options from tempest's tree
until liberty-eol (to tests stable branches) we can't have such options
on our tree, except of course new options like deploywait_timeout.

Change-Id: I563908626995b7f711e7bc3d1b756aa8dae7d261
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/96/275896/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(maurosr): Until liberty-eol we need to keep config options and tests # on tempest's tree to test stable branches and thus we have to comment the # options bellow to avoid duplication. Only new options should live here. # cfg.StrOpt('catalog_type', # default='baremetal', # help="Catalog type of the baremetal provisioning service"), # cfg.BoolOpt('driver_enabled', # default=True, # help="Whether the Ironic nova-compute driver is enabled"), # cfg.StrOpt('driver', # default='fake', # help="Driver name which Ironic uses"), # cfg.StrOpt('endpoint_type', # default='publicURL', # choices=['public', 'admin', 'internal', # 'publicURL', 'adminURL', 'internalURL'], # help="The endpoint type to use for the baremetal provisioning" # " service"), # cfg.IntOpt('deploywait_timeout', # default=15, # help="Timeout for Ironic node to reach the " # "wait-callback state after powering on."), # cfg.IntOpt('active_timeout', # default=300, # help="Timeout for Ironic node to completely provision"), # cfg.IntOpt('association_timeout', # default=30, # help="Timeout for association of Nova instance and Ironic " # "node"), # cfg.IntOpt('power_timeout', # default=60, # help="Timeout for Ironic power transitions."), # cfg.IntOpt('unprovision_timeout', # default=300, # help="Timeout for unprovisioning an Ironic node. " # "Takes longer since Kilo as Ironic performs an extra " # "step in Node cleaning.")

commit_message:
Add prefix to nodes hostnames in rabbit-fence

In this commit Ifc2af16b08663655d365587ea6f45c87bfc68698
we started to use prefixes for hostnames which point to
addresses from 'mgmt/messaging' network.
Adding corresponding change to the rabbit-fence code.

Change-Id: I7629d2b6e3cc672a75c49accf63b6bc5e130c843
Closes-bug: #1538597
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/01/275701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re node_name_prefix = bash_command('hiera node_name_prefix_for_messaging') if node_name_prefix == 'nil' or node_name_prefix in node_name: node_name_prefix = '' node_to_remove = 'rabbit@%s%s' % (node_name_prefix, node_name) if node == '' or re.search('\\b%s\\b' % this_node, node_name): cmd = 'rabbitmqctl forget_cluster_node %s' % node_to_remove
deleted_lines: node_to_remove = 'rabbit@%s' % node_name if node == '' or node_name == this_node: cmd = ('rabbitmqctl forget_cluster_node %s') % node_to_remove

Closes-Bug: #1541085

commit_message:
ODL v2: Check for CREATE operations only in validate method

The validation method _check_for_pending_or_processing_ops() should be
limited to check against operation=CREATE rows.

As currently used, this method may return rows where the operation type
is UPDATE.

Change-Id: I11a9503fe4b8522117f289b218c68fc00af4be0b
Closes-Bug: #1541085

commit_message:
Check context before returning cached value

The key manager caches the value of barbican client to be reused,
saving an extra call to keystone.  The cached value is only
applicable to the current context, so the context must be checked
before returning the cached value.

Change-Id: Ib10909a098fb2cd070129c239b6d3b95edc8fea0
Closes-Bug: #1523646
(cherry picked from commit 0832a0355381229ece235440a9c5de1301e51d07)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/78/266678/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._current_context = None # Confirm context is provided, if not raise not authorized if not ctxt: msg = _("User is not authorized to use key manager.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.NotAuthorized(msg) if not hasattr(ctxt, 'project_id') or ctxt.project_id is None: msg = _("Unable to create Barbican Client without project_id.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.KeyManagerError(msg) # If same context, return cached barbican client if self._barbican_client and self._current_context == ctxt: return self._barbican_client try: auth = identity.v3.Token( auth_url=CONF.keymgr.encryption_auth_url, token=ctxt.auth_token, project_id=ctxt.project_id) sess = session.Session(auth=auth) self._barbican_client = barbican_client.Client( session=sess, endpoint=self._barbican_endpoint) self._current_context = ctxt except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception(_LE("Error creating Barbican client."))
deleted_lines: if not self._barbican_client: # Confirm context is provided, if not raise not authorized if not ctxt: msg = _("User is not authorized to use key manager.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.NotAuthorized(msg) if not hasattr(ctxt, 'project_id') or ctxt.project_id is None: msg = _("Unable to create Barbican Client without project_id.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.KeyManagerError(msg) try: auth = identity.v3.Token( auth_url=CONF.keymgr.encryption_auth_url, token=ctxt.auth_token, project_id=ctxt.project_id) sess = session.Session(auth=auth) self._barbican_client = barbican_client.Client( session=sess, endpoint=self._barbican_endpoint) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception(_LE("Error creating Barbican client."))

commit_message:
enginefacade: 'provider_fw', 'console_pool' and 'console'

Use enginefacade in provider_fw', 'console_pool' and 'console' sections.

Implements: blueprint new-oslodb-enginefacade

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5ff2709f5af4eb78e11d6d4d5001497ce64bba66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/44/243544/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @main_context_manager.writer fw_rule_ref.save(context.session)@main_context_manager.reader@main_context_manager.writer def provider_fw_rule_destroy(context, rule_id): context.session.query(models.ProviderFirewallRule).\ filter_by(id=rule_id).\ soft_delete()@main_context_manager.writer pool.save(context.session)@main_context_manager.reader@main_context_manager.reader################## @main_context_manager.writer console.save(context.session)@main_context_manager.writer def console_delete(context, console_id): # NOTE(mdragon): consoles are meant to be transient. context.session.query(models.Console).\ filter_by(id=console_id).\ delete() @main_context_manager.reader@main_context_manager.reader@main_context_manager.reader
deleted_lines: fw_rule_ref.save()def provider_fw_rule_destroy(context, rule_id): session = get_session() with session.begin(): session.query(models.ProviderFirewallRule).\ filter_by(id=rule_id).\ soft_delete() pool.save() console.save()def console_delete(context, console_id): session = get_session() with session.begin(): # NOTE(mdragon): consoles are meant to be transient. session.query(models.Console).\ filter_by(id=console_id).\ delete()

commit_message:
enginefacade: 'instance_tags'

Use enginefacade in 'instance_tags' section.

Implements: blueprint new-oslodb-enginefacade

Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kholkin <pkholkin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I29b3c6bfdc2cb9e2b14faffd2b90dd0cbe896b03

added_lines: def _check_instance_exists_in_project(context, instance_uuid): if not model_query(context, models.Instance, read_deleted="no", project_only=True).filter_by(@main_context_manager.writer def instance_tag_add(context, instance_uuid, tag): _check_instance_exists_in_project(context, instance_uuid) context.session.add(tag_ref)@main_context_manager.writer def instance_tag_set(context, instance_uuid, tags): _check_instance_exists_in_project(context, instance_uuid) existing = context.session.query(models.Tag.tag).filter_by( resource_id=instance_uuid).all() existing = set(row.tag for row in existing) tags = set(tags) to_delete = existing - tags to_add = tags - existing if to_delete: context.session.query(models.Tag).filter_by( resource_id=instance_uuid).filter( models.Tag.tag.in_(to_delete)).delete( synchronize_session=False) if to_add: data = [ {'resource_id': instance_uuid, 'tag': tag} for tag in to_add] context.session.execute(models.Tag.__table__.insert(), data) return context.session.query(models.Tag).filter_by( resource_id=instance_uuid).all() @main_context_manager.reader def instance_tag_get_by_instance_uuid(context, instance_uuid): _check_instance_exists_in_project(context, instance_uuid) return context.session.query(models.Tag).filter_by( resource_id=instance_uuid).all() @main_context_manager.writer def instance_tag_delete(context, instance_uuid, tag): _check_instance_exists_in_project(context, instance_uuid) result = context.session.query(models.Tag).filter_by( resource_id=instance_uuid, tag=tag).delete() if not result: raise exception.InstanceTagNotFound(instance_id=instance_uuid, tag=tag) @main_context_manager.writer def instance_tag_delete_all(context, instance_uuid): _check_instance_exists_in_project(context, instance_uuid) context.session.query(models.Tag).filter_by( resource_id=instance_uuid).delete() @main_context_manager.reader def instance_tag_exists(context, instance_uuid, tag): _check_instance_exists_in_project(context, instance_uuid) q = context.session.query(models.Tag).filter_by( resource_id=instance_uuid, tag=tag) return context.session.query(q.exists()).scalar()

commit_message:
Clean flake8 ignore

There is no bad code violating PEP-8 and no need to ignore rules
E123 and E125. So clean the ignore list to do a more strict check.

Change-Id: Icf80d63396caceded1d897862b69226269b09296

commit_message:
Create nova-api database

This is a required patch.

Kilo introduced a nova-api database but didn't use it. [1]
Mitaka now uses it and has broken booting instances. [2]

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ReleaseNotes/Kilo#OpenStack_Compute_.28Nova.29
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/df0fca62cf5324f5b6eae0fed1f88c6c9ed61c71/releasenotes/notes/request-spec-api-db-b9cc6e0624d563c5.yaml

Change-Id: If0a7f4ba4937fab8d60f5236ca00db06faa768c7
Closes-Bug: #1540579
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/28/274928/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Creating Nova-api database command: docker exec -t kolla_ansible /usr/bin/ansible localhost -m mysql_db -a "login_host='{{ database_address }}' login_user='{{ database_user }}' login_password='{{ database_password }}' name='{{ nova_api_database_name }}'" register: database_api changed_when: "{{ database_api.stdout.find('localhost | SUCCESS => ') != -1 and (database_api.stdout.split('localhost | SUCCESS => ')[1]|from_json).changed }}" failed_when: database_api.stdout.split()[2] != 'SUCCESS' run_once: True delegate_to: "{{ groups['nova-api'][0] }}" - name: Reading json from variable set_fact: database_api_created: "{{ (database_api.stdout.split('localhost | SUCCESS => ')[1]|from_json).changed }}" - name: Creating Nova-api database user and setting permissions command: docker exec -t kolla_ansible /usr/bin/ansible localhost -m mysql_user -a "login_host='{{ database_address }}' login_user='{{ database_user }}' login_password='{{ database_password }}' name='{{ nova_api_database_name }}' password='{{ nova_api_database_password }}' host='%' priv='{{ nova_api_database_name }}.*:ALL' append_privs='yes'" register: database_api_user_create changed_when: "{{ database_api_user_create.stdout.find('localhost | SUCCESS => ') != -1 and (database_api_user_create.stdout.split('localhost | SUCCESS => ')[1]|from_json).changed }}" failed_when: database_api_user_create.stdout.split()[2] != 'SUCCESS' run_once: True delegate_to: "{{ groups['nova-api'][0] }}"

commit_message:
libvirt: deprecate live/block_migration_flag opts

Some of the migration flags really should never be changed by users
since the code makes fundamental assumptions about their use.

Now that live_migration_tunnelled is available, there shouldn't be any
remaining use cases for the live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag
options.

Deprecate these for removal in a future release.

Change-Id: I69c4bdf47a7b34b8dc8cfa58f3d0e0557b5ce072
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

commit_message:
HTTP errors have full error message

If HTTP error contains error message in json response, it is appended to
an exception raised.

exceptions_decorator is not used in fuel2, cliff has it's own error
handling

Change-Id: I8582e67e2061f5c941a22d32b0f4339f30142be2
Closes-bug: 1514906

commit_message:
Fix gate failures

Since Gnocchi 2.0, we return the full resource instead of just the id.

This change pretty prints the resource in that case.
And fixes the unit tests to match current master branch representation.

Then Gnocchi 2.0, doesn't provide keystone by default anymore and
provide a new paste configuration.

This change removes the custom paste/policy configurations.

Also Gnocchi 2.0, doesn't conver user/project id in UUID anymore.
So tests around that are removed

Change-Id: I89b4846a7f1efddac4cc6ae7c8f6323046c12adf

commit_message:
Make dse2 tests run properly with tox -enew_arch

Previously, the dse2 tests didn't run with tox -enew_arch
since there was no __init__.py file in the dir.  Also,
the tests weren't set up to use the distributed_architecture
flag.

This change addresses both issues.

Implements: blueprint dist-integrate-new-dse
Change-Id: Ie1d733b8a4e3df18b689628890a4ee632fb43905
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/64/275464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 14:34:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/c93be97a190ead875ec951f689d0f0374539eff0', 'message': "dockerctl: Add bootstraps directory to SYSTEM_DIRS

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch adds /var/www/nailgun/bootstraps/ to SYSTEM_DIRS list in
dockerctl's configuration file, so it will be retained during
backup-reinstall-restore procedure.

Change-Id: I3945200d02b29ed10e60900f7d03ed30970159a3
Closes-Bug: #1536198
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-21 05:19:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/d06cb9277f5b9500d780884a0d59ae7302e6c6b0', 'message': "dockerctl: Add bootstraps directory to SYSTEM_DIRS

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch adds /var/www/nailgun/bootstraps/ to SYSTEM_DIRS list in
dockerctl's configuration file, so it will be retained during
backup-reinstall-restore procedure.

Change-Id: I3945200d02b29ed10e60900f7d03ed30970159a3
Closes-Bug: #1536198
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-27 12:32:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/f0aa3e85733aad0ae021d943db2f1b2afc5ea44d', 'message': "dockerctl: Add bootstraps directory to SYSTEM_DIRS

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch updates authorized_keys inside squashfsed bootstrap images,
so it will be retained during backup-reinstall-restore procedure, if
user has not requested a full backup. Full backups already contain a
full copy of /var/www/nailgun, so no changes are needed.

Change-Id: I3945200d02b29ed10e60900f7d03ed30970159a3
Closes-Bug: #1536198
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-27 12:33:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/dfbc492b24d032f305126eb3d774e747ed907fe2', 'message': "dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch updates authorized_keys inside squashfsed bootstrap images,
so it will be retained during backup-reinstall-restore procedure, if
user has not requested a full backup. Full backups already contain a
full copy of /var/www/nailgun, so no changes are needed.

Change-Id: I3945200d02b29ed10e60900f7d03ed30970159a3
Closes-Bug: #1536198
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-02 14:41:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/d1c05d8f0ba9de3f0e19055c01ac5fdfb799dd4e', 'message': 'dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch updates authorized_keys inside squashfsed bootstrap images,
so it will be retained during backup-reinstall-restore procedure, if
user has not requested a full backup. Full backups already contain a
full copy of /var/www/nailgun, so no changes are needed.

User should carefully restore from non-full backups - only active
bootstrap will have its ssh keys updated. To propagate ssh keys to
already running nodes, you can use something like:
  mco rpc --agent execute_shell_command --action execute --arg cmd="echo '$(cat /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub)' >> /root/.ssh/authorized_keys" -v

commit_message:
dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch updates authorized_keys inside squashfsed bootstrap images,
so it will be retained during backup-reinstall-restore procedure, if
user has not requested a full backup. Full backups already contain a
full copy of /var/www/nailgun, so no changes are needed.

User should carefully restore from non-full backups - only active
bootstrap will have its ssh keys updated. To propagate ssh keys to
already running nodes, you can use something like:
  mco rpc --agent execute_shell_command --action execute --arg cmd="echo '$(cat /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub)' >> /root/.ssh/authorized_keys" -v

Change-Id: I3945200d02b29ed10e60900f7d03ed30970159a3
Closes-Bug: #1536198
DocImpact

commit_message:
Add missing database constraints and defaults

The project table was missing a constraint on the external_id column.
The secret and container ACLs tables were missing a default value of
True for the project_access column.

Change-Id: I5bd4bc9bca830a37d841434c07a80ce857b676bb

subject: Use host href for version discovery
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-29 06:02:37.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/api/controllers/versions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/8a14e0e7d2ba58fc43d0c9020d70e6f6efea66a4', 'message': 'Use host href for version discovery

In barbican we already use the host_href coming from the configuration
to return the paths the user needs to use to retrieve their respective
secrets. This, however, is not the case for version discovery. The
version discovery (json-home) implementation done in barbican will
return the path by which barbican was accessed. This is problematic
because it might not be the path that we want to expose barbican
through. On the other hand, we might want to enforce the usage of TLS
for accessing barbican; This will not be the case if there is a
possibility of accessing barbican through plain HTTP (in the case where
the loadbalancer is not explicitly blocking so).

As a solution, the json-home output will be the value that was
configured in the host_href option. This will then return endpoints for
keystone discovery that coincide with the paths that are returned with
entities.

Change-Id: I69f556c09f072b47e9f8e776ccd4db209b25485f
'}]
commit_message:
Use host href for version discovery

In barbican we already use the host_href coming from the configuration
to return the paths the user needs to use to retrieve their respective
secrets. This, however, is not the case for version discovery. The
version discovery (json-home) implementation done in barbican will
return the path by which barbican was accessed. This is problematic
because it might not be the path that we want to expose barbican
through. On the other hand, we might want to enforce the usage of TLS
for accessing barbican; This will not be the case if there is a
possibility of accessing barbican through plain HTTP (in the case where
the loadbalancer is not explicitly blocking so).

As a solution, the json-home output will be the value that was
configured in the host_href option. This will then return endpoints for
keystone discovery that coincide with the paths that are returned with
entities.

Change-Id: I69f556c09f072b47e9f8e776ccd4db209b25485f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/95/273895/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def _get_versioned_url(full_url, version): parsed_url, _ = parse.urldefrag(full_url) return parse.urljoin(parsed_url, version) 'href': _get_versioned_url(request.url, cls.version_string), url = _get_versioned_url(request.url, DEFAULT_VERSION)

commit_message:
Fix devstack function call recreate db

Devstack function "recreate_database" takes only one argument.
UTF8 is activated by default, see:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/126267/

Trivial-fix

Change-Id: Ie43fdaa6f60641bf6d5717f4e358434758dae8e6

commit_message:
Use regex for matching node in rabbit-fence logs

Currently it's possible to add special prefixes for
hostnames which are used by RabbitMQ (messaging network).
Modified tests, so such prefixes are ignored while
parsing rabbit-fence logs.

Also change 'get_rabbit_running_nodes' method to
omit node name prefixes while returning list of running
nodes.

Change-Id: I63bac7c4eafa61fc756d033dadd7d2ba662eaf4c
Closes-bug: #1538597
Closes-bug: #1539586

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 12:57:50.000000000', 'files': ['manila/post_test_hook.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/commit/1aa19075c21fd1fe2c2cb3c9c6bd5454b9c14da4', 'message': "manila CI hook: disable glusterfs protocol

glusterfs protocol. The glusterfs protocol is enabled by a manila's

glusterfs protocol.

commit_message:
manila CI hook: disable glusterfs protocol

manila's cephfs-native CI tests cephfs driver, which does not support
glusterfs protocol. The glusterfs protocol is enabled by a manila's
tempest config option by default. Modify the config option to disable
glusterfs protocol.

Change-Id: Ia7a226d6a8b0ba5aeedcdf34e8a6f9a8dbbfda40
Closes-Bug: #1541377
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph refs/changes/78/275678/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG share enable_cert_rules_for_protocols

commit_message:
Register the keystone service and endpoint in the devstack plugin

The name is "baremetal-introspection", the same as in puppet-ironic:
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ironic/blob/master/manifests/keystone/auth_inspector.pp

Change-Id: Ib22c758f70cf6403e5d8b400af4df62caba9dece
Related-Bug: #1391865
